questions.question_text: On an incident record, where are the fields that appear on the caller lookup select box defined?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
servicenow.read.inkling.com
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation On Demand
Module 5.3: Incident Management
Page: Caller Details 

Answer is B
Answer's on 248 for Vancouver
So, how are we supposed to answer this on the test? With the correct answer, B? or the wrong answer, A?

Selected Answer: B
This topic is mentioned in the on-demand course

Selected Answer: B
From the book:
However, additional fields may be added by adding the ref_ac_column attribute from the dictionary entry and listing all the columns you want visible for the Caller Lookup Select Box

Selected Answer: B
focus on "select box" not prewview icon.

Selected Answer: B
Per the diagram on pg 265 of the Tokyo ebook, #2 on the left corresponds to #2 on the right.
B is correct.

Selected Answer: B
ref_ac_column attribute from the dictionary entry

Selected Answer: B
REF AC IS CORRECT

Selected Answer: B
The ref_ac_column attribute from the dictionary entry defines the fields that appear on the caller lookup select box on an incident.

Selected Answer: B
B correct
p265
Point number 2
its ref_ac_columns

Selected Answer: A
It's A the correct answer, as reported in the ebook

Selected Answer: B
This is actually B. I think some people are hung up on the select box when it's asking where the FIELDS are configured that appear there. Not where the select box or icons are configured
All options seems incorrect. The columns on the Caller Lookup list are define in UI View -> sys_ref_list -> List(related list) -> sys_user -> List elements

B is correct.
ITSM implementation Tokyo eBook pg 265

Selected Answer: C
C is correct as it states the select box not the actual reference, misleading but C is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: C
The ref_contributions attribute controls the icons that appear next to the reference field:

https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-platform-administration/page/administer/field-administration/concept/c_AutoCompleteForReferenceFields.html

The columns displayed is controlled by ref_ac_columns

C, ref_contributions. 

Option A (The Caller lookup field on the [user] table) is not correct because the lookup select box is part of the incident form, not the [user] table.

Selected Answer: A
correct

choices.B: The ref_ac_column attribute from the dictionary entry
choices.D: The form design of the caller lookup form
choices.C: The ref_contributions attribute on the caller lookup form
choices.A: The Caller lookup field on the [user] table

discussion.content:

Technically, none of the solutions are correct. The right answer is on p270. "Search as" is set on the "Search as" tab in Contextual Search > Table Configuration. It has nothing to do with Related Search.

Module 5.3: Incident Management
Page: Contextual Search Properties

C is correct

discussion.content:

Correct

2. If the Assignment group is empty and you are a member of a single group, the Assignment group field is filled in and the record is assigned to you.

Answer is B

However, this question has a "s" on the word "group", making it "groups", and that confused me initially.

Selected Answer: B

Selected Answer: B
It’s written in the given e-book
Correct answer is B

Selected Answer: C
The field is prompted in red and it remains with no value
Its letter C

choices.B: The Assignment group field is populated with agent’s user group
choices.C: An error is displayed indicating the Assignment group field must be populated before executing the Assign to me UI action
choices.A: The agent is prompted to select the Assignment group
choices.D: The Assignment group field remains empty

questions.question_text: If the Assignment group is empty on an incident record, what happens when an agent that is a member of a single user groups clicks the Assign to me UI action?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct

questions.question_text: A problem record is the Parent to what record?

choices.A: System Policy > Rules > Priority Lookup Rules

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Problem > Administration > Problem Properties, under Problem Created from Incident Properties, add the column names (incident) seperated by a comma.

B is correct.
ITSM implementation Tokyo pg 347

Selected Answer: B
Correct

questions.question_text:
When you create a problem from an incident, impact, urgency and priority are automatically populated, from the incident record. Your problem management process owner wants the problem manager to be responsible for assessing the impact and urgency on the problem, so they don't want the values from incident to be copied over.
What module would you use to make this adjustment?
